column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=But if you 're not getting paid to be a sponsor for all that is awesome in Australia , what do you do outside of skiing , and the long jump , and the javelin ?
#Text=I 'm an osteopath .
#Text=So I finished my masters ' degree in 2009 .
#Text=I was completing a bachelor 's and a masters .
#Text=I was working for the Victorian Institute of Sport guiding program but with the commitment to London having so much travel I actually just put everything on hold in terms of my osteo career .
#Text=There 's not really enough time .
#Text=And then the ambassador role , I had a few commitments with that , and I did motivational speaking .
#Text=That 's very cool .
#Text=Eric , I 've read that you work as a guide in back country skiing , and all sorts of crazy stuff like that .
#Text=What do you do when you 're not leading Jessica Gallagher down a ski slope ?
#Text=I 'm the Chief Executive of Disabled Winter Sports Australia .
#Text=So we look after all the disability winter sports , except for the Paralympics .
#Text=Social , recreational ...
#Text=You like that ?
#Text=You find it fulfilling ?
#Text=The skiing aspect 's good .
#Text=I dunno about the corporate stuff .
#Text=I could give that a miss .
#Text=But I think it is quite fulfilling .
#Text=Yeah , they 're a very good group of people there who enjoy themselves , both in disabilities and able bodied .
#Text=We really need guides and support staff .
#Text=Has it changed over the last few years ?
#Text=For us ?
#Text=Being a guide in general ?
#Text=How things have changed or improved , have you been given more recognition ?
#Text=No. I do n't see myself as an athlete .
#Text=Legally we are the athlete .
#Text=If I fail , she fails .
#Text=We ski the exact same course .
#Text=But there 's some idiosyncrasies associated with it .
#Text=Because I 'm a male guiding , I have to ski on male skis , which are different to female skis , which means my turn shape I have to control differently so it 's the same as her turn shape .
#Text=It 's a little bit silly .
#Text=Whereas if I was a female guiding , I 'd be on exactly the same skis , and we 'd be able to ski exactly the same all the way through .
#Text=In that context I think the fact that Jess won the medal opened the eyes to the APC about visual impairment as a definite medal contending aspect .
#Text=The biggest impediment to the whole process is how the Hell do you get a guide who 's ( a ) capable , ( b ) available and ( c ) able to fund himself .

#Text=So we 're fortunate that the APC pushed for the recognition of myself as an athlete , and because we have the medal from the previous Olympics , we 're now tier one , so we get the government funding all way through .
#Text=Without that two years before the last games , that cost me fifteen , sixteen months of my time , and $ 40,000 of cash to be the guide .
#Text=So while I enjoyed it , and well I did , it is very very hard to say that a guide could make a career out of being a guide .
#Text=There needs to be a little bit more consideration of that , a bit like the IPC saying no you 're not a medal winner .
#Text=It 's quite a silly situation where it 's written into the rules that you are both the athlete and yet at the same time you 're not a medal winner .
#Text=I think there 's evolution .
#Text=It 's growing .
#Text=It 's changing .
#Text=It 's very , very difficult .
